definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once

sentences.english: Thus, the poor Jia woman finds herself unable to find a mate by virtue of her high income.
sentences.chinese: 因此，甲等女人就因爲自己收入高而找不到伴侶。

sentences.english: Jia men and women are rich businesspeople and professionals.
sentences.chinese: 甲等男女屬於富商以及專業人士。

sentences.english: While he looks away, she sneaks onto the first class deck.
sentences.chinese: 趁他朝別處看是，她溜進了甲等艙船面。

sentences.english: A student who gets 90%25 is graded A.
sentences.chinese: 凡得90分的學生列爲甲等。

definition: 2nd rank of candidates who passed the imperial examination (i.e. 4th place and up)
1st rank or top three candidates who passed the imperial examination (i.e. 狀元|状元[zhuang4 yuan2], 榜眼[bang3 yan3], and 探花[tan4 hua1], respectively)
3rd rank of candidates who passed the imperial examination
Putonghua Proficiency Test, an official test of spoken fluency in Standard Chinese for native speakers of Chinese languages, developed in the PRC in 1994
pinyin: Pu3 tong1 hua4 Shui3 ping2 Ce4 shi4

definition: military officer/ranked officer in Chinese army, divided into 大校, 上校, 中校, 少校
